image.altText: Interior gallery with wooden floor and white wall with large textile work in shape of Tasmania in floral stitched fabric.

props.synopsis: "Dangerously low" arts sector funding has rendered the Tasmanian industry "highly vulnerable", with funding stagnant since 2016-17, the state government has conceded.

title.children: 'Major reputational risk': Briefing gives warning to Tasmanian arts minister

image.altText: Generic photos of a mental health facility.

props.synopsis: Despite the offer of a $2 million lifeline to keep a private mental health clinic in Hobart open, last-minute wobbles could yet scupper the rescue bid, as the clinic's shareholders prepare to meet on Monday.

title.children: The Hobart Clinic rescue hinges on Monday shareholder meeting

image.altText: a heritage home in need of repair

props.synopsis: In northern Tasmania, Woolmers Estate is recognised for its heritage charm. But buckets to catch drips and cracks in walls show how that could change.

title.children: Time feels frozen inside Woolmers Estate, but the cracks are beginning to show

image.altText: Two climbers dressed in black on top of a rock pillar.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian wilderness retrievals are rarely straightforward, and now the teams involved in some of the state's most complex rescue efforts have been awarded at a national level.

title.children: Seacliff climb, freezing trek and river amputation earn national rescue awards

image.altText: A photo from the March for Australia rally in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson's daughter Lee stood unsuccessfully at this year's federal election for a Tasmanian Senate spot but continues to be a keynote speaker at anti-immigration rallies. Airlie Ward takes a deep dive with investigative reporter Paddy Manning.

title.children: TassieCast: Is this part of a One Nation succession plan?

image.altText: A number of illustrations of grocery items, like milk, apples, sausages, around two 'specials' signs 'half price' and '40% off'.

props.synopsis: Research finding supermarkets continue to offer discounts and multi-buy deals on junk food more frequently than healthy food prompts calls for Australia to follow England's lead and ban "buy one, get one free" deals.

title.children: The UK has banned junk food specials, experts say Australia should too

image.altText: A BHP Group logo is displayed on their building

props.synopsis: The resolution of negotiations between Australian mining giant BHP and China's state-backed iron ore buyer China Mineral Resources Group could reshape not just the resources industry, but also international trade flows, global markets, and the relationship between China and the West.

title.children: What are BHP and China fighting over and why does it matter for Australia?

image.altText: AI child abuse phone generic

props.synopsis: A senior academic has warned a Sydney school caught up in an investigation into digitally altered explicit images of female students is just "another shocking iteration" of gendered violence.

title.children: Academic's warning on explicit AI images amid Sydney schoolgirls report

image.altText: A skull lies among artefacts from World War Two under the water of Chuuk Lagoon in Micronesia.

props.synopsis: The Federated States of Micronesia's biggest tourism asset has become one of its largest threats, with as much as 22 million litres of oil from World War II shipwrecks slowly leaking into the ocean.

title.children: Micronesia's worst fears realised as WWII shipwrecks leak

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: As SA Police and ADF personnel prepare to scour remaining areas in an expanded search zone for four-year-old Gus, a missing persons advocate has spoken out about the emotional impact of such cases on all families who have experienced the disappearance of a loved one.

title.children: Expanded search for Gus nears conclusion as missing persons advocate speaks out

image.altText: Zach Merrett high fives fans walking through the race

props.synopsis: The AFL trade period offered three different test cases on just how much value a first-round pick holds during negotiations. Two stars got their moves, while one was left stranded.

title.children: Merrett trade saga shows it is time to stop using first-round picks to judge deals

image.altText: Two men shake hands.

props.synopsis: The US president says his Indian counterpart has made the pledge, as pressure continues to mount over the purchases that fund Moscow's war in Ukraine.

title.children: 'A big step': Trump says India will stop buying Russian oil

image.altText: A middle aged Caucasian man with dark hair wearing a suit looking frustrated.

props.synopsis: Despite the reprieve, the motions underscore the fragility of President Emmanuel Macron's administration midway through his final term.

title.children: Embattled French PM Sebastien Lecornu survives no-confidence votes

image.altText: Close-up of an adult powerful owl showing its huge yellow eyes

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A deported star, a shock retirement and the hottest place on Earth

image.altText: Minjee Lee swings the golf club

props.synopsis: Australia's golf aces are left needing to play catch-up as a hometown hero sets the pace to begin the BMW Ladies Championship in South Korea.

title.children: Lee and fellow Australians off to slow start at BMW Ladies Championship

image.altText: Lucy Derbyshire standing on the shore, at the beach, wearing a competition swimsuit, hands on hips.

props.synopsis: Lucy Derbyshire enters this year's Iron Series as the defending champion and has set her sights on winning the Coolangatta Gold for the first time.

title.children: Iron Series champ looking to add Gold to her list of accolades

image.altText: Two men on a busy city street unroll an orange electrical cable.

props.synopsis: Canada's cult web series heads to the big screen, after creators Matt Johnson and Jay McCarrol were told they could make any movie they liked after their success with BlackBerry.

title.children: From cult web series to cinema: Nirvanna the Band the Show the Movie

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market falls after a downbeat session on Wall Street, weighed down by a sell-off across US regional bank stocks. Gold jumped to a new record high, above $US4,300 an ounce, as investors flocked to safe haven assets amid US-China trade tensions. Follow live.

title.children: ASX slips as gold surges to new record above $US4,300

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX critical minerals stocks caught in sell-off
Gold mining stocks jump as precious metal's spot hits new record, above $US4,300
ASX falls 0.3 per cent in early trade

image.altText: Ferres Wang outside an apartment building with construction, wearing a purple shirt.

props.synopsis: Dozens of high-rise apartment buildings across the state are still covered in flammable cladding as the NSW government's scheme has failed to fix them on schedule.

title.children: How many NSW apartment buildings still have flammable cladding

image.altText: Fish eye still of dog running to attack

props.synopsis: A behavioural veterinarian says there's not usually one direct cause for dogs attacking, and owner education could help improve the rate of horror incidents.

title.children: As dog attacks continue to make headlines, what rules exist for owners?

image.altText: A man holds two casts of skulls in each hand and smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: A new study claims lead might be the reason why Homo sapiens came to dominate the world.

title.children: New research claims lead was causing headaches even in ancient times

image.altText: Matt, left, sits on a bench outside while Kate stands with her arms around him, both smiling proudly.

props.synopsis: Kate and Matt knew they had to do things differently if they ever wanted to live in their dream home. Not only did they swap the city for regional Tasmania and build a house using recycled bottles — they also relied on volunteers.

title.children: Priced out of Melbourne, this family built an earthship

image.altText: A crowd of people holding up flags, knives and signs with arabic writing.

props.synopsis: An Israeli air strike targeting top leaders in Yemen's Houthi rebels in August killed its military's chief of staff, officials say, further escalating the tensions between the group and Israel even as a ceasefire holds in Gaza.

title.children: Houthi rebels confirm military chief of staff was killed in Israeli strikes in August

image.altText: A smiling female cricketer in an Australian uniform gestures with her bat.

props.synopsis: Australian captain Alyssa Healy scores her second straight century as her side maintains its unbeaten record at the cricket World Cup with a 10-wicket win over Bangladesh.

title.children: Healy smashes World Cup's fastest ton as Australia books semifinal spot

image.altText: Blue background with black grid and piles of coinsincreasing in height with a shadow.

props.synopsis: Australians were allowed to withdraw $1.37 billion from their superannuation accounts for medical costs last financial year, in another jump from previous years.

title.children: Health practitioner watchdog 'stunned' amid ongoing super trend

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus smiles while holding a gold medal.

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus has given her life to a dream. As she sets off on her next adventures, she can be in no doubt that her years of sacrifice and devotion were worth it.

title.children: After a life of sacrifice, Ariarne Titmus can finally enjoy her greatness

image.altText: Group of city workers walking on street

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate jumped to 4.5 per cent in September, up from 4.3 per cent in August.

title.children: Chance of a November rate cut doubles after shock unemployment jump

image.altText: an Australian flag pictured on the uniform of Australian Army personnel.

props.synopsis: The Department of Defence says an Australian soldier has died after a single-vehicle rollover during training at the Australian Army's Townsville Field Training Area.

title.children: Army vehicle fleet suspended after training rollover kills soldier

image.altText: A composite image of Robbie Arnott, a man in his mid-30s, and Tasma Walton, a short-haired Indigenous woman in her early 50s.

props.synopsis: Robbie Arnott's Dusk about twins hunting a puma in Tasmania, and Tasma Walton's I Am Nannertgarrook about an Aboriginal woman kidnapped and sold into slavery, have tied to win the ARA Historical Novel Prize.

title.children: 'Impossible to elevate one above the other' as two authors split $100k prize

image.altText: Virginia Giuffre with her therapy dog Juno, a French bulldog, in Cairns in Far North Queensland.

props.synopsis: Extracts from Virginia Giuffre's posthumously released memoir have further intensified the recently renewed scrutiny on Prince Andrew.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre's memoir renews allegations against Prince Andrew

image.altText: A woman sits on a desk in front of a blackboard

props.synopsis: The ingredients are all here — public scandal, duelling divas and unearthed secrets — but Luca Guadagnino's provocative drama misses the mark.

title.children: Julia Roberts helms queasy #MeToo drama, After the Hunt

image.altText: Diane Keaton wearing a blue bowler hat and black, plaid turtleneck while smiling

props.synopsis: The actor's family says the 79-year-old died of pneumonia, expressing gratitude for the "extraordinary messages of love and support" received following news of her passing.

title.children: Keaton's cause of death revealed as fans urged to support shelters

image.altText: Teddy Swims sitting on an orange chair in front of an orange wall wearing orange shades, black suit, tattoos, bald head

props.synopsis: Grammy-nominated music artist Teddy Swims says AI is a "beautiful tool" when it comes to composing music. Swims was in conversation at SXSW Sydney.

title.children: Teddy Swims occasionally uses AI to make music, but warns of its dangers
